description: Polygon Longform is a podcast containing spoken word versions of our in-depth features and monthly covers. If you like stories about not only games but the artists who make them, the fans who love them and the culture surrounding them, then this is the show for you.
title: Polygon Longform

episodes.subtitle: How economic sanctions and piracy shape how peopl…
episodes.description: How economic sanctions and piracy shape how people in Iran make and play games. Read the full feature here: http://is.gd/nZps3R Subscribe to Polygon Longform to get every episode as soon as it's released: - iTunes: itunes.com/polygonlongform - RSS for your podcast player for choice: feed://feeds.feedburner.com/PolygonLongform - SoundCloud: @polygon-longform - Download the MP3: polygon.com/longform
episodes.title: The game industry of Iran

episodes.subtitle: In January 2010, Donald Mustard was sitting on hi…
episodes.description: In January 2010, Donald Mustard was sitting on his couch when he made a decision that would change his life, the course of his company and send him on a collision course with Star Wars: The Force Awakens director J.J. Abrams. And it was kind of an accident. Read the full feature here: http://is.gd/Wkgx4W Subscribe to Polygon Longform to get every episode as soon as it's released: - iTunes: http://itunes.com/polygonlongform - RSS for your podcast player for choice: feed://feeds.feedburner.com/PolygonLongform - SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/polygon-longform - Download the MP3: http://polygon.com/longform
episodes.title: How Shadow Complex led Chair to Infinity Blade, to Star Wars, to J.J. Abrams and back again

episodes.subtitle: With remasters in vogue and ports in the spotligh…
episodes.description: With remasters in vogue and ports in the spotlight, we look at the art of transferring games to new hardware. Read the feature here: http://www.polygon.com/e/9554069
episodes.title: Bridging the generation gap: Porting games to new platforms

episodes.subtitle: Blizzard wraps up StarCraft 2 on Nov. 10. But tha…
episodes.description: Blizzard wraps up StarCraft 2 on Nov. 10. But that isn't the end for the franchise. In Polygon's latest cover story, we speak with those behind the real-time strategy series, who look back on the past and forward to the future. Read the feature here: http://www.polygon.com/e/9434217
episodes.title: StarCraft: The past, present and future

episodes.subtitle: The story of how Trion World is creating Atlas Re…
episodes.description: The story of how Trion World is creating Atlas Reactor — and the things its developers are learning along the way. It started with a pitch jotted down in stream-of-consciousness on a piece of paper. It wasn't a very good pitch. Read the feature and see the game in action here: http://www.polygon.com/features/2015/10/28/9629428/trion-labs-atlas-reactor-feature-gameplay-video-mmo-studio-behind-the-scenes
episodes.title: Atlas Reactor: How an MMO studio set out to create the next great competitive game

episodes.subtitle: How Shahid Ahmad breathed new life into the PlayS…
episodes.description: How Shahid Ahmad breathed new life into the PlayStation Vita and prepared the company for the PlayStation 4. Read the full feature here: http://www.polygon.com/e/9173738
episodes.title: PlayStation Vita may die childless, but it changed Sony in time for the PS4

episodes.subtitle: We explore the fascinating technology behind Appl…
episodes.description: We explore the fascinating technology behind Apple TV's apps. Read the full feature here: http://www.polygon.com/features/2015/10/26/9604068/apple-tv-app-size-limit-technology-slicing-tags-200-mb
episodes.title: Apple TV is a radical rethinking of your relationship with the hardware and games you own

episodes.subtitle: With a hit under their belts, the makers of Gone …

episodes.title: Tacoma, Fullbright and the new world of making games

episodes.subtitle: When someone at some point in the chain doesn’t w…

episodes.subtitle: In 2015, Electronic Arts is one of the largest vi…
episodes.description: In 2015, Electronic Arts is one of the largest video game publishers, with studios around the world and thousands of employees working on some of the industry's biggest games. When the company started more than 30 years earlier, things were quite different.
episodes.title: How Electronic Arts Lost Its Soul
